topic: Identify the XSS type in a real scenario
answer: A social profile page renders usernames using innerHTML. When a user sets their username to `<script>alert('x')</script>`, every visitor gets an alert. What XSS type is this? What exactly caused it? (Answer: Stored XSS due to unsanitized user input rendered as HTML.)

A banking session cookie uses `SameSite=Lax`. Explain which CSRF attacks are blocked and which are still possible when the victim clicks a malicious link. (Answer: Cross-site POSTs from hidden forms are blocked. Top-level GET navigation can still send cookies.)
Given the vulnerable query: `SELECT * FROM users WHERE id = ${id}`, what input would return all users? Why? (Answer: `1 OR 1=1` because it turns the WHERE clause into a tautology.)
Write a tcpdump command that shows only TCP traffic to port 443, without hostname or port name resolution. (Answer: `sudo tcpdump -i any -nn tcp port 443`)
Which flag writes raw packets to a .pcap file? Provide an example command. (Answer: `-w`. Example: `sudo tcpdump -i eth0 -s 0 -w capture.pcap`)
Write an iptables rule to drop all inbound traffic from 192.168.1.50. (Answer: `sudo iptables -A INPUT -s 192.168.1.50 -j DROP`)

Explain the difference between these two commands and when you would use each:
`iptables -A INPUT ...`
`iptables -I INPUT 1 ...`
(Answer: -A appends to end of chain; -I inserts at top position 1. -I is used when rule order matters.)
You can ping 8.8.8.8 but cannot ping google.com. What is the exact problem, and what file would you check first on Linux? (Answer: DNS issue. Check /etc/resolv.conf.)

You added your public key to `~/.ssh/authorized_keys` on a server, but SSH still asks for a password. What file permission issue causes this? (Answer: ~/.ssh must be 700 and authorized_keys must be 600.)
A systemd service fails on startup. What exact command shows its logs and failure reason? (Answer: `sudo journalctl -u <service-name> -xe`)
